page.title: 10 FARMING
page.content: THE FARMS IN THE AREA VARY IN SIZE FROM 120 TO JUST UNDER 400 ACRES.THE LAND ALSO VARIES IN HEIGHT FROM OVER 700 FEET TO 300 FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL. AND DRAINS FROM THE CAMP RIDGE TO THE VALLEY OF THE SOUTH ESK. THE SOIL IS DESCRIBED BY FARMERS AS BEING AVERAGE IT IS ENRICHED BY ORGANIC AND CHEMICAL FERTILISERS.CROPS ARE MAINLY BARLEY, WHEAT,OATS,POTATOES,TURNIP,PEAS,OIL SEED RAPE AND GRASS FOR HAY & SILAGE. THE CROPS VARY LITTLE FROM YEAR TO YEAR BUT OIL SEED RAPE IS BEGINNING TO PROVE A POPULAR CROP.THERE IS DAIRY, FATSTOCK AND SHEEP FARMING.REDHEUGH FARM HAS 220 GREY FACED SUFFOLK EWES AND 150 BULLOCKS FOR FATTENING WHILE ANOTHER FARM HAS OVER 200 PIGS.ALL FARMS ARE WELL EQUIPPED WITH MODERN MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT SUCH AS LARGE POWERFUL TRACTORS,COMBINE HARVESTERS AND REVERSIBLE PLOUGHS
